item.title: ティム・デイヴィによると、警察はBBCに対し、犯罪捜査の根拠があるかどうかを判断するため、停職中の司会者についての捜査を一時停止するよう要請した（Jim Waterson/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Jim Waterson / The Guardian:
Tim Davie says police asked the BBC to pause its investigation into a suspended presenter as officers decide if there are grounds for a criminal investigation  —  Corporation's director general reveals request as officers consider if there is reason for a criminal inquiry

item.title: BBC、2022-2023年のBBCスタジオの売上高は前年比28％増の20.9億ポンド、EBITDAは前年比6％増の2.4億ポンド、BBCへの利益還元は過去最高の3.62億ポンドを記録（Georg Szalai/Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Georg Szalai / Hollywood Reporter:
The BBC reports record BBC Studios revenue up 28% YoY to £2.09B in 2022-2023, EBITDA rose 6% YoY to £240M, and returns to the BBC reached a record £362M  —  Thanks to hit content, such as ‘Happy Valley,’ 'Bluey, and ‘Dancing With the Stars,’ the commercial arm …

item.title: BBCは2022-2023年に1億2,000万ポンドの赤字と過去最高の57億ポンドの収入を計上、ライセンス料の支払いは前年比6,000万ポンド減の37億4,000万ポンドとなる（Naman Ramachandran/Variety）
item.description:
Naman Ramachandran / Variety:
The BBC reports a £120M deficit and record income of £5.7B in 2022-2023, with license fee payments making up £3.74B, down £60M YoY  —  The BBC has posted a record income of £5.7 billion ($7.2 billion) for the 2022/23 period, up from £5.33 billion last year, but is in deficit by £120 million.

item.title: カナダ、法案C-18の規制の概要を発表、責任に上限を設け、メタ社とグーグル社のカナダでの収益に基づく最低拠出金を設定（マイケル・ガイスト氏）
item.description:
Michael Geist:
Canada outlines planned regulations for Bill C-18 that cap liability and set minimum financial contributions by Meta and Google based on their Canadian revenue  —  Canadian Heritage Minister Pablo Rodriguez has insisted for months that Bill C-18, the Online News Act, is a market-based approach …

item.title: ソースInstagram、Threadsにブランデッドコンテンツツールを追加し、マーケティング担当者に有料プロモーションを提供する計画。
item.description:
Axios:
Source: Instagram plans to add branded content tools to Threads, offering marketers paid promotion; Threads won't introduce ads before reaching a critical mass  —  Instagram is planning to bring its branded content tools to Threads, a source told Axios, giving marketers a way to get involved …

item.title: フィナンシャル・タイムズ紙、FTプロフェッショナルのリブランディングでB2Bビジネスに参入 FTの有料読者の75％がB2B購読者であることを理由に（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
The Financial Times leans into its B2B business with FT Professional rebranding, citing that 75% of the FT's paying readers come from B2B subscriptions  —  B2B subscriptions account for 75% of the FT's paying readers.  —  The Financial Times is targeting growth in its B2B division …

item.title: 獄中のイラン人女性ジャーナリストElaheh MohammadiとNiloufar Hamedi、およびイランが著名な政治犯をどのように扱っているかについて、CPJのYeganeh RezaianにQ&A（Michael Lipin/Voice of America）
item.description:
Michael Lipin / Voice of America:
Q&A with CPJ's Yeganeh Rezaian on jailed female Iranian journalists Elaheh Mohammadi and Niloufar Hamedi and how Iran handles high-profile political prisoners  —  WASHINGTON - A U.S. media rights group says Iran has kept two jailed female journalists in legal limbo for more than a month …

item.title: メタ社は、オーストラリアの外国からの干渉に関する調査に対し、「国営メディア」と「ファクトチェック」のラベルをスレッド上に「迅速に」構築する計画だと語った（ロイター）。
item.description:
Reuters:
Meta told an Australian inquiry on foreign interference that it plans to build “state-affiliated media” and “fact-checking” labels on Threads “expeditiously”  —  Social media giant Meta Platforms (META.O), owner of Facebook and Instagram …

item.title: ロサンゼルス・タイムズ紙は、ウェブサイトでは英語優位のラテン系、インスタグラムやTikTokでは若いニュース読者にリーチするため、無料の独立型バーティカル番組「De Los」をデビューさせた（Hanaa' Tameez/Nieman Lab）。
item.description:
Hanaa' Tameez / Nieman Lab:
The Los Angeles Times debuts De Los, a free, standalone vertical to reach English-dominant Latinos on its website and young news readers on Instagram and TikTok  —  “There is no future for the L.A. Times without Latino subscribers, because that's who lives here.”

item.title: 1月6日に出席したトランプ有権者レイ・エップスによるフォックス・ニュース名誉毀損裁判の計画と、～20話で陰謀論に名を連ねたタッカー・カールソン（ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
New York Times:
A look at a planned Fox News defamation case by Ray Epps, a Trump voter who attended January 6 and Tucker Carlson named in a conspiracy theory in ~20 episodes  —  Tucker Carlson, before he was sidelined by Fox, repeatedly endorsed a conspiracy theory about an Arizona man, who may sue for defamation.

item.title: パトリック・スンシオンとその一族は、サンディエゴ・ユニオン・トリビューン紙を、オールデン・グローバル・キャピタルが所有する新聞社メディアニュース・グループの関連会社に売却した（Meg James/Los Angeles Times）。
item.description:
Meg James / Los Angeles Times:
Patrick Soon-Shiong and his family sell the San Diego Union-Tribune to an affiliate of MediaNews Group, the newspaper publisher owned by Alden Global Capital  —  Patrick Soon-Shiong and his family have sold the San Diego Union-Tribune to competing publisher MediaNews Group …

item.title: グーグル、Googleニュースのインデックス作成に継続的な問題があることを確認、全サイトに影響があり、アグリゲーターからパブリッシャーへのトラフィックが減少する可能性がある（Barry Schwartz/Search Engine Land）
item.description:
Barry Schwartz / Search Engine Land:
Google confirms an ongoing issue with Google News indexing, which is affecting all sites and may cause a decrease in traffic from the aggregator to publishers  —  This bug may be impacting publisher traffic from Google News.  —  Google has confirmed an issue with indexing content …

item.title: 米非営利団体The National Trust for Local Newsは、メイン州の日刊紙6紙のうち5紙と週刊紙17紙を含むMasthead Maine社の全資産を買収する計画だ（Rachel Ohm/Press Herald）。
item.description:
Rachel Ohm / Press Herald:
US nonprofit The National Trust for Local News plans to acquire all Masthead Maine's assets, including five of Maine's six daily newspapers and 17 weeklies  —  The National Trust for Local News has agreed to purchase 5 of the state's 6 daily papers and 17 of its weeklies in an effort to preserve local journalism.

item.title: National PostとToronto Sunを発行するPostmedia NetworkとToronto StarとMetroland Mediaを所有するNordstar Capitalが合併交渉を中止（Clarrie Feinstein/Toronto Star）
item.description:
Clarrie Feinstein / Toronto Star:
Postmedia Network, the publisher of the National Post and Toronto Sun, and Nordstar Capital, which owns Toronto Star and Metroland Media, call off merger talks  —  Talks called off due to regulatory and financial uncertainty around the deal and because parties were unable to agree on terms.

item.title: BBCに宛てた手紙の中で、BBCの司会者から性的な写真を撮られ、3万5,000ポンドを受け取ったとされるティーンエイジャーの弁護士は、『ザ・サン』紙の主張は「でたらめ」だと述べている（James Gregory/BBC）
item.description:
James Gregory / BBC:
In a letter to the BBC, a lawyer for the teen allegedly paid £35K by a BBC presenter for sexually explicit photos says the claims made in The Sun are “rubbish”  —  Claims made by the mother at the heart of the BBC presenter scandal are “rubbish”, a lawyer representing the young person has said.
